text.p: A stake of 7.00 million shares in Russian natural gas monopoly RAO Gazprom sold at auction on Tuesday at an average 2,182.32 roubles ($0.400) a share, down from 2,870.06 roubles at the previous auction on October 30, the Federal Securities Corporation (FFK) said.
Since auctions began in March 1996, 221 million shares, equivalent to 0.93 percent of the capital, have changed hands, the FFK said.
Prices have risen from an average 406.60 roubles a share at the first auction on March 6. For the last two weeks the average price has fallen, and not all lots have been sold.
Gazprom is one of Russia's biggest companies by market capitalisation but its 23.6 billion shares are highly illiquid because of company restrictions on selling them.
The company has organised the auctions to create an orderly market in its paper.
Gazprom was $0.434 at 1530 GMT on Tuesday on the Russian Trading System, unchanged from Monday's close.
Its American Depositary Shares were $17.80 after $17.65. One ADS is equivalent to 10 ordinary shares.
The next auction will be held on November 13, when 10 million shares in 40 lots will be offered at a starting price of 2,073 roubles a share. Further auctions will be held on November 20 and 27.
